description: Tracks how often users successfully return after drift or dropout, using PLD-based reentry flows.

panels.title: ðŸŒ€ Reentry Rate Over Time
panels.query:
SELECT date_trunc('hour', "timestamp") AS time_slot,
       (COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE event_type = 'reentry_success'))::float
       / NULLIF(COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE event_type = 'drift_detected'), 0) AS reentry_rate
FROM pld_events
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: â± Average Time to Reentry (s)
panels.query:
WITH re AS (
  SELECT e.*, COALESCE(
    NULLIF((e.metadata->>'reentry_lag')::numeric, NULL),
    EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (
      e."timestamp" - (
        SELECT MAX(d."timestamp")
        FROM pld_events d
        WHERE d.session_id = e.session_id
          AND d.event_type = 'drift_detected'
          AND d."timestamp" <= e."timestamp"
      )
    ))
  ) AS re_lag
  FROM pld_events e
  WHERE e.event_type = 'reentry_success'
)
SELECT date_trunc('day', "timestamp") AS day, AVG(re_lag) AS avg_lag
FROM re
WHERE re_lag IS NOT NULL AND re_lag < 600
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: ðŸ”€ Repair vs. Reentry Pathways
panels.query:
SELECT COALESCE(
  NULLIF(metadata->>'recovery_mode', ''),
  CASE
    WHEN event_type = 'repair_triggered' THEN 'repair'
    WHEN event_type = 'reentry_success' THEN 'reentry'
    ELSE 'drift'
  END
) AS recovery_mode,
COUNT(*) AS count
FROM pld_events
WHERE event_type IN ('drift_detected', 'repair_triggered', 'reentry_success')
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY count DESC

panels.title: ðŸŒ¡ Drift Occurrence Heatmap
panels.query:
SELECT COALESCE(NULLIF(metadata->>'ui_state',''), '(unknown)') AS ui_state,
       COALESCE(NULLIF(metadata->>'drift_type',''), 'unspecified') AS drift_type,
       COUNT(*) AS drift_count
FROM pld_events
WHERE event_type = 'drift_detected'
GROUP BY 1,2
ORDER BY drift_count DESC

panels.title: ðŸ”— Top Reentry Sources
panels.query:
SELECT metadata->>'prior_context_id' AS resumed_context_id,
       COUNT(*) AS uses,
       AVG(
         EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (
           e."timestamp" - (
             SELECT MAX(d."timestamp")
             FROM pld_events d
             WHERE d.session_id = e.session_id
               AND d.event_type = 'drift_detected'
               AND d."timestamp" <= e."timestamp"
           )
         ))
       ) AS avg_lag
FROM pld_events e
WHERE event_type = 'reentry_success'
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY uses DESC
LIMIT 10

panels.title: ðŸš¨ Unresolved Drifts (no repair/reentry within 2 min)
panels.query:
WITH d AS (
  SELECT session_id, "timestamp" AS drift_ts,
         COALESCE(NULLIF(metadata->>'context_id',''), '(no_context)') AS context_id
  FROM pld_events
  WHERE event_type = 'drift_detected'
), next_fix AS (
  SELECT d.context_id, d.session_id, d.drift_ts,
         EXISTS (
           SELECT 1 FROM pld_events e
           WHERE e.session_id = d.session_id
             AND e."timestamp" >= d.drift_ts
             AND e."timestamp" <= d.drift_ts + INTERVAL '2 minutes'
             AND e.event_type IN ('repair_triggered','reentry_success')
         ) AS resolved
  FROM d
)
SELECT context_id,
       COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE NOT resolved) AS unresolved_count
FROM next_fix
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY unresolved_count DESC
LIMIT 10
